title: Show HN: How did your computer reach my server?
iMessage, explained
dot: digraph imessage{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box];subgraph cluster_foundation{label="Foundational Layer";apns[label="Apple Push Notification Service (APNs)"];device[label="Device"];apns->device[label="Device connects, gets push token"];apns->device[label="Device sends filter message"];note1[label="APNs token different from app - specific token", shape=diamond];note2[label="Specify topic (e.g. com.apple.madrid) for message", shape=diamond];note3[label="APNs server also known as APNs Courier", shape=diamond];note4[label="Connect to APNs needs client certificate from Albert activation server", shape=diamond];}subgraph cluster_keyserver{label="Keyserver (IDS)";ids[label="Identity Services (IDS)"];appleid[label="Apple ID Username and Password"];auth_token[label="Authentication Token"];auth_cert[label="Authentication Certificate"];appleid->auth_token[label="Provide to get token"];note5[label="2FA options: legacy (append code to password) or GrandSlam (use Anisette data)", shape=diamond];auth_token->auth_cert[label="Exchange for certificate"];device->ids[label="Registration (upload keys, client data)"];note6[label="Requires validation data (uses device info)", shape=diamond];note7[label="pypush emulates binary to generate validation data", shape=diamond];ids->device[label="Receive identity keypair"];device->ids[label="Lookup (provide accounts, get identities)"];note8[label="Session tokens expire, can't be shared", shape=diamond];}subgraph cluster_encryption{label="Message Encryption";device->apns[label="Filter APNs connection (com.apple.madrid), send active state packet"];device->device[label="Receive messages (pair or pair - ec format)"];device->device[label="Decrypt message, verify signature (optional)"];device->apns[label="Send messages (individually or in bundle)"];note9[label="Message delivered to all conversation participants", shape=diamond];note10[label="AES key tagged with HMAC", shape=diamond];}subgraph cluster_resources{label="Resources and Attribution";resource1[label="IMFreedom Knowledge Base: iMessage"];resource2[label="M. Frister: pushproxy"];resource3[label="Nicolás: apns - dissector"];resource4[label="QuarkSlab: iMessage Privacy"];resource5[label="Garman et al. Chosen Ciphertext Attacks on Apple iMessage"];resource6[label="NowSecure: Reverse Engineering iMessage"];resource7[label="Elcomsoft: iMessage Security and Attachments"];resource8[label="Eric Rabil’s open - imcore"];resource9[label="The Apple Wiki: Apple Push Notification Service"];resource10[label="Mihir Bellare and Igors Stepanovs: Security under Message - Derived Keys: Signcryption in iMessage"];resource11[label="Apple Platform Security: How iMessage sends and receives messages securely"];resource12[label="Nicolás: Apple IDS payload keys"];resource13[label="Various people on the Hack Different Discord"];}}
